description:
Costa Rica, 17th of march 2020. National suspension of lessons.
This measure taken by the ministry of health applies at the national level. This means that lessons will be suspended as a preventive and necessary measure in the efforts to contain the spread of COVID-19.

Article 1: Lessons in the Costa Rican education system are temporarily suspended for the levels of Preschool Education, 1, 2 and 3 of General Basic Education (EGB) and Diversified Education in all public and private educational modalities authorized or recognized by the Ministry of Public Education, throughout the country.

Article 2: The national suspension of lessons agreed by the authorities of health and public education will be in force from Tuesday, March 17 to Friday, April 3, 2020. The re-entry to lessons of the student population of public and private schools and teachers, administrative teachers and technical teachers of public and private schools will take place on Monday, April 13 this year.

This applies from the 17th of March 2020 until the 13th of April 2020.

description:
Costa Rica 30th of July 2021. school opening restrictions.

This measure taken by the ministry of health applies to all at the national level. This means that schools will open with mixed methods with some face to face lessons for the younger students. 

The purpose of this resolution is to temporarily enable pedagogical mediation under the modality of combined education, understood as the pedagogical strategy that enables teachers to offer support to the student in two different learning environments:

1.  work in person, in subgroups 
2. work on distance, using technological resources, when possible, or printed material

teaching in person is preferred for students of public and private educational services of preschool education, I, II and III
cycle of basic general education.

This applies from the 12th of  January 2021 until no specific end date.

description:
Costa Rica 13th August 2021. General guidelines for the resumption of face-to-face services in public and private educational centers in the face of the Coronavirus (COVID-19).

description:
Costa Rica, 16th March 2020. Government declares a state of National Emergency, prevents the arrival of foreigners and suspends lessons in all educational centers in the country. This measure is taken by the ministry of health and applies to all at the national level. 

This means that: 
-Mandatory isolation measures for those who enter the country will be applied by sanitary order, these will be implemented from today.
-Suspension of educational centers throughout the country will not affect food services to protect the most vulnerable population.
-The care networks (daycare) will remain open to ensure that mothers who are heads of households can continue working.
-It is recommended to work from home if possible.

These measures apply from the 16th of March 2020 to  the1st of August 2020.

Costa Rica, 28.02.2020. Authorities publish protocol against COVID-19 for the Juan Santamaria international airport in San Jose. The acquisition in the secondary market by the Central Bank of titles of the Ministry of Finance does not constitute financing to the Government, since the purchase of the holdings would be made to a third party, who would be the one who receives the money for the acquisition made by the Central Bank.

Given that this instrument is an exceptional mechanism, the Central Bank restricts its participation to situations of systemic tension, and therefore limits the amount of its intervention and imposes restrictions on the type of holdings that can be acquired and their issue and placement date.

The Central Bank will publish on its website the information on the secondary market transactions carried out under this agreement, at the end of each day in which it carries out said transactions.

description:
Costa Rica, 23.03.2020:
The Central Administration is instructed and the Decentralized Administration is urged to establish a basic operating service plan, to guarantee the continuity of the essential tasks in order to ensure the institutional public purpose. For these purposes, institutions may require a maximum attendance of 20% of their total payroll.
The basic operating service plan must include:
a) The application of the teleworking modality in those positions that are possible.
b) The justification of the services that are essential for the operation of the institution.
c) Strict health measures to be applied in the case of workers who must attend in person.

The institutions of the Central Administration must:
a) Apply the telework modality in everything since it is teleworkable.
b) Grant vacations to all those servants who have
accumulated vacation periods.
c) If the servants do not have accumulated periods,
vacation advancement is authorized.

All public servants who are over 65 years of age or have risk factors must be guaranteed with an option to work remotely or take vacation.

This policy applies to all at the national level and is effective 26/03/2020 and is open ended.

description:
Costa Rica 26/02/2020.  Costa Rican government introduces General guidelines for the transfer of people confirmed or suspected by COVID-19. Transfer of patients (symptomatic, asymptomatic, confirmed or suspected cases):

• Public or private vehicles must have natural ventilation and a physical distance must be maintained between the driver and the passenger. The maximum distance to make this trip is 50 km.
• Patient transport ambulance preferably with a driver's cabin physically separated from the patient transport module.
• No “stop” should be made until you reach the destination.
• Only confirmed people may participate in the transfer
unaccompanied
• all parties must wear masks and employers must provide personal protective equipment to professional drivers

This policy applies from the 26th of February 2020 and is open ended.

description:
Costa Rica 06/04/2021. Costa Rican government introduces guidelines for the use of public outside spaces for recreational and physical activity purposes including those with perimeter enclosure (Public Services). The guidelines apply to recreational parks, urban parks, biosaludable parks, calisthenics parks and public green spaces administered by integral development associations, municipalities, cantonal sports and recreation committees or other public institutions.  

Venues must:
• Facilitate necessary protection measures for staff
that serves the public, such as hygiene implements, protective equipment or barriers between staff and users.
• Include signage and announce distancing measures
to avoid crowds at the entrance.
• The entry and stay of people with symptoms should be prevented
• Enforce 1.8 meter distance with people from different social bubbles.
• Lavatories and toilets, these must have toilet paper, drinking water, antibacterial soap for hand washing or an antiseptic solution of at least 70% alcohol or ethanol. If possible paper towels, as well as garbage containers.
• The surfaces of bathrooms, toilets and showers should be cleaned with disposable material and a log kept. It should be cleaned with soap and water, with a 70% alcohol solution, or with bleach at a dilution of 1: 100, prepared the same day it is to be used (10 ml of 5% chlorine per litre of water).

This policy applies to all at the national level and is effective 06/04/2021 and open-ended.

description:
Costa Rica 01/04/2020. Costa Rican government announces a framework of containment measures. Measures do not restrict access to basic services. 

This means that from Friday, April 3 and until Tuesday, April 7, there will be a night vehicle restriction is extended throughout the national territory from 5:00 pm to 5:00 am.
Long-distance public transport will also be restricted and establishments will be closed with sanitary operating permits and attention to face-to-face public, home services are allowed.

This policy applies to all at the national level and is applicable from the 3rd of April 2020 to the 7th of April 2020.
Starting Saturday, April 4 and until Tuesday, April 7, the daytime vehicle restriction will apply from 5:00 am to 5:00 pm throughout the country, with license plate distribution. The movement of vehicles and public transport is restricted, with exceptions.

There is also a total restriction on vehicular traffic with the following exceptions: access to supermarkets, suppliers, grocery stores, pharmacies and health centers, without time restrictions.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date

March 24, 2020, Costa Rica
Decree N° 42253-MOPT-S
Costa Rica is putting in place a nocturnal obligatory vehicle restriction in order to mitigate the effects of COVID-19. Between 22:00 and 05:00 hours, no vehicular transit is allowed all the national territory. [from Articles 2, 3]
Some exceptions apply, including vehicular circulation for wok, public transportation, and other basic services. Vehicles circulating within the time restrictions have to abide by Ministry of Health’s guidelines, and must be able to demonstrate the exception. [from Articles 4, 5, 6]
This measure will be maintained for the duration of the national emergency, and will be revised according to the epidemiological behavior of COVID-19. This measure will take effect March 24, 2020 at 22:00 hours [from Articles 9, 10]

description:
Costa Rica 06/04/2021. Costa Rican government introduces guidelines for the use of public outside spaces for recreational and physical activity purposes including those with perimeter enclosure (Public Services). The guidelines apply to recreational parks, urban parks, biosaludable parks, calisthenics parks and public green spaces administered by integral development associations, municipalities, cantonal sports and recreation committees or other public institutions.  

Venues must:
• Facilitate necessary protection measures for staff
that serves the public, such as hygiene implements, protective equipment or barriers between staff and users.
• Include signage and announce distancing measures
to avoid crowds at the entrance.
• The entry and stay of people with symptoms should be prevented
• Enforce 1.8 meter distance with people from different social bubbles.
• Lavatories and toilets, these must have toilet paper, drinking water, antibacterial soap for hand washing or an antiseptic solution of at least 70% alcohol or ethanol. If possible paper towels, as well as garbage containers.
• The surfaces of bathrooms, toilets and showers should be cleaned with disposable material and a log kept. It should be cleaned with soap and water, with a 70% alcohol solution, or with bleach at a dilution of 1: 100, prepared the same day it is to be used (10 ml of 5% chlorine per litre of water).

This policy applies to all at the national level and is effective 06/04/2021 and open-ended.
